analogy.title: The Career Progression
analogy.subtitle: Think of software development like building a cityâ€”each tier represents mastery of a different scale of responsibility.

junior.description: Like a skilled plumber executing precise blueprintsâ€”you master foundational tools and execute well-defined tasks with reliability and precision.

senior.description: Like a city architect designing neighborhoodsâ€”you define scalable infrastructure, mitigate risks (zoning, security), and present strategic vision to stakeholders.

introductory.title: Introductory Module
introductory.description: Enable students to efficiently execute well-defined programming tasks under guidance, while establishing foundational Computer Science knowledge, structured collaboration habits, and reliable persistence skills.

modules.title: Web Foundations & Git
modules.tech: Semantic HTML5, CSS3 (Flexbox/Grid), Responsive Design, ARIA, Git Workflow
modules.outcome: Personal Portfolio Website (fully responsive, accessible)

modules.details: Master foundational algorithms and data structures essential for technical interviews. Regular timed assessments build problem-solving speed.

modules.title: React Library Immersion
modules.tech: React JSX, Functional Components, Hooks (useState, useEffect), Client-side Routing, UI Libraries, Linting, Component Testing
modules.outcome: Component Library with Clean Git History

modules.outcome: Deployed API with Logs & Cross-Browser Testing
modules.details: Create backend services with proper persistence and production-ready monitoring. Deploy to real hosting environments.

softSkills.focus: Curiosity & Adaptability, Team Communication, Learning from Guidance

introductory.capstone: Personal Portfolio Website + API Integration Project with Production Deployment

problemSolver.title: Problem-Solver

ai.title: AI Engineer Career Preparation
ai.description: Transition engineers from traditional full-stack development into production-grade AI system builders capable of designing, evaluating, and scaling LLM-powered systems with clear cost, reliability, and safety guarantees.

modules.title: Applied AI Fundamentals for Engineers
modules.tech: ML vs DL vs LLMs, Tokens, Context Windows, Embeddings, Inference vs Training, Latency & Cost Models
modules.outcome: AI Decision Matrix: When to Use (and Not Use) AI
modules.details: Develop first-principles understanding of AI capabilities, limits, and trade-offs. Engineers learn to justify AI adoption using cost, latency, and accuracy constraints.

modules.title: LLM APIs & Prompt Engineering (Production Grade)
modules.tech: OpenAI APIs, Prompt Patterns, Few-shot Learning, JSON Mode, Function Calling, Prompt Guardrails
modules.outcome: Versioned Prompt Library with Automated Evaluations
modules.details: Design deterministic, testable prompts treated as production artifacts with regression testing.

modules.title: Embeddings, Vector Databases & Semantic Retrieval
modules.tech: Embeddings, Chunking Strategies, Cosine Similarity, Vector Databases (FAISS/Pinecone), Hybrid Search
modules.outcome: Semantic Search Engine over Real-World Dataset
modules.details: Build retrieval systems that outperform keyword search and minimize hallucinations.

modules.title: Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) Systems
modules.tech: Advanced Chunking, Re-ranking, Context Assembly, Citation Injection, Failure Modes
modules.outcome: Enterprise-Grade RAG System with Accuracy Benchmarks
modules.details: Design hallucination-resistant RAG pipelines with measurable quality guarantees.

modules.title: Agentic Workflows & Tool-Using Systems
modules.tech: Tool Calling, Planning vs Reactive Agents, Memory, Agent Graphs, Multi-Agent Coordination
modules.outcome: Autonomous Agent Solving a Real Business Workflow
modules.details: Build agents that reason, act, recover from failure, and respect execution boundaries.

modules.title: AI Evaluation, Safety & Reliability
modules.tech: Golden Datasets, Offline/Online Evals, Prompt Regression, Bias & Toxicity Checks, Guardrails
modules.outcome: Automated AI Evaluation & Monitoring Pipeline
modules.details: Treat AI like production software: measured, tested, and continuously monitored.

modules.title: AI System Design & Cost Optimization
modules.tech: Latency Budgets, Streaming Inference, Caching, Rate Limits, Cost Control, Failure Scenarios
modules.outcome: AI System Design Document (LLM at Scale)
modules.details: Architect AI systems that survive real traffic, real budgets, and real failure conditions.

softSkills.focus: AI Trade-off Reasoning, Risk Communication, Explaining Uncertainty to Stakeholders
softSkills.assessment: AI Design Reviews, Failure Post-Mortems, Cost Justification Documents
softSkills.details: Engineers must clearly articulate why an AI system is safe, reliable, and economically viable.

ai.capstone: Production AI System: RAG or Agent-Based Platform with Evaluations, Cost Controls, and Reliability Guarantees
